snippet: Sierra Leone thought it had beaten back the disease, then two fishing boats carrying three infected mariners arrived at a wharf in February.
abstract: Fresh outbreak of Ebola in Sierra Leone caused by sick fisherman coming ashore highlights challenges of completely eliminating any trace of highly contagious diseases; surge of new cases in country's capital of Freetown offers warning that war on Ebola, while progress has been made, is still critical.
lead_paragraph: Sierra Leone thought it had beaten back the disease, then two fishing boats carrying three infected mariners arrived at a wharf in February.

headline.main: Nearly Halted in Sierra Leone, Ebola Makes Comeback by Sea
headline.print_headline: Nearly Halted in Sierra Leone, Ebola Makes Comeback by Sea

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
